description: Z.ai prompt templates for generating valid YAWL XML specifications

basic_sequence.name: Basic Sequence Workflow
basic_sequence.description: Creates a simple sequential workflow pattern
basic_sequence.prompt:
Generate a YAWL XML specification for a basic sequence workflow with the following requirements:

{{requirements}}

The workflow should:
1. Use YAWL Schema 4.0
2. Follow the standard YAWL XML structure
3. Include proper names and documentation
4. Use XOR joins and splits for sequential flow
5. Include input and output conditions
6. Have at least one atomic task

Generate the complete specification XML that validates against the YAWL Schema 4.0.
basic_sequence.example_output:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<specificationSet version="4.0" xmlns="http://www.yawlfoundation.org/yawlschema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.yawlfoundation.org/yawlschema http://www.yawlfoundation.org/yawlschema/YAWL_Schema4.0.xsd">
  <specification uri="sequenceWorkflow">
    <metaData>
      <title>Sequence Workflow Example</title>
      <creator>YAWL Z.ai Generator</creator>
      <description>A simple sequential workflow pattern</description>
      <version>1.0</version>
    </metaData>
    <decomposition id="mainFlow" xsi:type="NetFactsType" isRootNet="true">
      <name>Main Flow</name>
      <processControlElements>
        <inputCondition id="start">
          <name>Start</name>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="task1"/>
          </flowsInto>
        </inputCondition>
        <task id="task1">
          <name>First Task</name>
          <documentation>Perform the initial task</documentation>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="task2"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="and"/>
        </task>
        <task id="task2">
          <name>Second Task</name>
          <documentation>Perform the second task</documentation>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="end"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="and"/>
        </task>
        <outputCondition id="end">
          <name>End</name>
        </outputCondition>
      </processControlElements>
    </decomposition>
  </specification>
</specificationSet>

parallel_split_sync.name: Parallel Split and Synchronization
parallel_split_sync.description: Creates a workflow with parallel execution and synchronization
parallel_split_sync.prompt:
Generate a YAWL XML specification for a parallel workflow pattern:

{{requirements}}

The workflow should:
1. Use YAWL Schema 4.0
2. Include a parallel split (AND split) to execute multiple tasks simultaneously
3. Include a synchronization (AND join) to wait for all parallel tasks to complete
4. Use XOR joins for single path selection
5. Include proper documentation and naming
6. Validate against YAWL Schema 4.0

Generate the complete specification XML.
parallel_split_sync.example_output:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<specificationSet version="4.0" xmlns="http://www.yawlfoundation.org/yawlschema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.yawlfoundation.org/yawlschema http://www.yawlfoundation.org/yawlschema/YAWL_Schema4.0.xsd">
  <specification uri="parallelWorkflow">
    <metaData>
      <title>Parallel Workflow Example</title>
      <creator>YAWL Z.ai Generator</creator>
      <description>Parallel split and synchronization pattern</description>
      <version>1.0</version>
    </metaData>
    <decomposition id="parallelFlow" xsi:type="NetFactsType" isRootNet="true">
      <name>Parallel Flow</name>
      <processControlElements>
        <inputCondition id="start">
          <name>Start</name>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="splitTask"/>
          </flowsInto>
        </inputCondition>
        <task id="splitTask">
          <name>Split Task</name>
          <documentation>Task before parallel split</documentation>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="taskA"/>
            <predicate>conditionA</predicate>
            <isDefaultFlow/>
          </flowsInto>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="taskB"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="and"/>
        </task>
        <task id="taskA">
          <name>Task A</name>
          <documentation>First parallel task</documentation>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="sync"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="and"/>
        </task>
        <task id="taskB">
          <name>Task B</name>
          <documentation>Second parallel task</documentation>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="sync"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="and"/>
        </task>
        <task id="sync">
          <name>Synchronization Task</name>
          <documentation>Waits for both parallel tasks to complete</documentation>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="end"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="and"/>
          <split code="and"/>
        </task>
        <outputCondition id="end">
          <name>End</name>
        </outputCondition>
      </processControlElements>
    </decomposition>
  </specification>
</specificationSet>

exclusive_choice.name: Exclusive Choice Pattern
exclusive_choice.description: Creates a workflow with exclusive choice (XOR branch selection)
exclusive_choice.prompt:
Generate a YAWL XML specification for an exclusive choice workflow pattern:

{{requirements}}

The workflow should:
1. Use YAWL Schema 4.0
2. Implement exclusive choice where only one branch is selected based on conditions
3. Use XOR joins and splits
4. Include predicates for conditional routing
5. Include proper documentation for each task
6. Validate against YAWL Schema 4.0

Generate the complete specification XML with proper conditional flows.
exclusive_choice.example_output:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<specificationSet version="4.0" xmlns="http://www.yawlfoundation.org/yawlschema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.yawlfoundation.org/yawlschema http://www.yawlfoundation.org/yawlschema/YAWL_Schema4.0.xsd">
  <specification uri="exclusiveChoiceWorkflow">
    <metaData>
      <title>Exclusive Choice Workflow</title>
      <creator>YAWL Z.ai Generator</creator>
      <description>Exclusive choice pattern with conditional routing</description>
      <version>1.0</version>
    </metaData>
    <decomposition id="choiceFlow" xsi:type="NetFactsType" isRootNet="true">
      <name>Choice Flow</name>
      <processControlElements>
        <inputCondition id="start">
          <name>Start</name>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="choiceTask"/>
          </flowsInto>
        </inputCondition>
        <task id="choiceTask">
          <name>Choice Task</name>
          <documentation>Determines which branch to execute based on conditions</documentation>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="branchA"/>
            <predicate>priority == 'high'</predicate>
            <isDefaultFlow/>
          </flowsInto>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="branchB"/>
            <predicate>priority == 'medium'</predicate>
          </flowsInto>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="branchC"/>
            <predicate>priority == 'low'</predicate>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="xor"/>
        </task>
        <task id="branchA">
          <name>High Priority Branch</name>
          <documentation>High priority processing</documentation>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="merge"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="and"/>
        </task>
        <task id="branchB">
          <name>Medium Priority Branch</name>
          <documentation>Medium priority processing</documentation>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="merge"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="and"/>
        </task>
        <task id="branchC">
          <name>Low Priority Branch</name>
          <documentation>Low priority processing</documentation>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="merge"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="and"/>
        </task>
        <task id="merge">
          <name>Merge Task</name>
          <documentation>Merges all branches back together</documentation>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="end"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="and"/>
        </task>
        <outputCondition id="end">
          <name>End</name>
        </outputCondition>
      </processControlElements>
    </decomposition>
  </specification>
</specificationSet>

multiple_instance.name: Multiple Instance Pattern
multiple_instance.description: Creates a workflow with multiple instance execution
multiple_instance.prompt:
Generate a YAWL XML specification for a multiple instance workflow pattern:

{{requirements}}

Additional requirements:
{{additional_requirements}}

The workflow should:
1. Use YAWL Schema 4.0
2. Use MultipleInstanceExternalTaskFactsType for dynamic task generation
3. Set minimum and maximum instances
4. Include threshold for activation
5. Use dynamic creation mode
6. Include proper data mappings
7. Validate against YAWL Schema 4.0

Generate the complete specification XML with multiple instance configuration.
multiple_instance.example_output:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<specificationSet version="4.0" xmlns="http://www.yawlfoundation.org/yawlschema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.yawlfoundation.org/yawlschema http://www.yawlfoundation.org/yawlschema/YAWL_Schema4.0.xsd">
  <specification uri="multipleInstanceWorkflow">
    <metaData>
      <title>Multiple Instance Workflow</title>
      <creator>YAWL Z.ai Generator</creator>
      <description>Multiple instance task with dynamic creation</description>
      <version>1.0</version>
    </metaData>
    <decomposition id="miFlow" xsi:type="NetFactsType" isRootNet="true">
      <name>Multiple Instance Flow</name>
      <inputParam name="itemList">
        <type>xs:string</type>
      </inputParam>
      <localVariable name="processedItems">
        <type>xs:string</type>
        <initialValue>""</initialValue>
      </localVariable>
      <processControlElements>
        <inputCondition id="start">
          <name>Start</name>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="miTask"/>
          </flowsInto>
        </inputCondition>
        <task id="miTask" xsi:type="MultipleInstanceExternalTaskFactsType">
          <name>Process Multiple Items</name>
          <documentation>Processes each item from the input list</documentation>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="end"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="and"/>
          <minimum>3</minimum>
          <maximum>10</maximum>
          <threshold>5</threshold>
          <creationMode code="dynamic"/>
          <miDataInput>
            <expression query="/data/itemList"/>
            <splittingExpression query="for $item in /data/itemList/* return $item"/>
            <formalInputParam>item</formalInputParam>
          </miDataInput>
          <completedMappings>
            <mapping>
              <expression query="concat(/data/processedItems, $result, '; ')"/>
              <mapsTo>processedItems</mapsTo>
            </mapping>
          </completedMappings>
        </task>
        <outputCondition id="end">
          <name>End</name>
        </outputCondition>
      </processControlElements>
    </decomposition>
  </specification>
</specificationSet>

web_service_integration.name: Web Service Integration
web_service_integration.description: Creates a workflow with web service gateway integration
web_service_integration.prompt:
Generate a YAWL XML specification for a workflow with web service integration:

{{requirements}}

Additional configuration:
{{ws_config}}

The workflow should:
1. Use YAWL Schema 4.0
2. Include WebServiceGatewayFactsType for external service calls
3. Configure external interaction mode (manual/automated)
4. Include proper resourcing if needed
5. Add timer configuration if required
6. Validate against YAWL Schema 4.0

Generate the complete specification XML with web service integration.
web_service_integration.example_output:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<specificationSet version="4.0" xmlns="http://www.yawlfoundation.org/yawlschema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.yawlfoundation.org/yawlschema http://www.yawlfoundation.org/yawlschema/YAWL_Schema4.0.xsd">
  <specification uri="wsIntegrationWorkflow">
    <metaData>
      <title>Web Service Integration Workflow</title>
      <creator>YAWL Z.ai Generator</creator>
      <description>Workflow with external web service integration</description>
      <version>1.0</version>
    </metaData>
    <decomposition id="wsFlow" xsi:type="NetFactsType" isRootNet="true">
      <name>Web Service Flow</name>
      <inputParam name="requestData">
        <type>xs:string</type>
      </inputParam>
      <processControlElements>
        <inputCondition id="start">
          <name>Start</name>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="wsTask"/>
          </flowsInto>
        </inputCondition>
        <task id="wsTask">
          <name>Call Web Service</name>
          <documentation>Invokes external web service</documentation>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="end"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="and"/>
          <decomposesTo id="webServiceGateway"/>
          <resourcing>
            <offer initiator="system"/>
            <allocate initiator="user"/>
            <start initiator="system"/>
          </resourcing>
          <timer>
            <trigger>OnEnabled</trigger>
            <expiry>300000</expiry>
            <workdays>true</workdays>
          </timer>
        </task>
        <outputCondition id="end">
          <name>End</name>
        </outputCondition>
      </processControlElements>
    </decomposition>
    <decomposition id="webServiceGateway" xsi:type="WebServiceGatewayFactsType">
      <name>External Service Gateway</name>
      <documentation>Web service integration endpoint</documentation>
      <externalInteraction>automated</externalInteraction>
      <yawlService id="externalService">
        <wsdlLocation>http://example.com/service?wsdl</wsdlLocation>
        <operationName>processRequest</operationName>
        <documentation>External service operation</documentation>
      </yawlService>
    </decomposition>
  </specification>
</specificationSet>

resourced_workflow.name: Resourced Workflow
resourced_workflow.description: Creates a workflow with human resource allocation
resourced_workflow.prompt:
Generate a YAWL XML specification for a workflow with human resource allocation:

{{requirements}}

Resource configuration:
{{resource_config}}

The workflow should:
1. Use YAWL Schema 4.0
2. Include resourcing configuration with participant and role assignments
3. Configure proper allocation and start modes
4. Include privileges if specified
5. Set external interaction to manual for human tasks
6. Validate against YAWL Schema 4.0

Generate the complete specification XML with resourcing configuration.
resourced_workflow.example_output:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<specificationSet version="4.0" xmlns="http://www.yawlfoundation.org/yawlschema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.yawlfoundation.org/yawlschema http://www.yawlfoundation.org/yawlschema/YAWL_Schema4.0.xsd">
  <specification uri="resourcedWorkflow">
    <metaData>
      <title>Resourced Workflow</title>
      <creator>YAWL Z.ai Generator</creator>
      <description>Workflow with human resource allocation</description>
      <version>1.0</version>
    </metaData>
    <decomposition id="resourcedFlow" xsi:type="NetFactsType" isRootNet="true">
      <name>Resourced Flow</name>
      <processControlElements>
        <inputCondition id="start">
          <name>Start</name>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="manualTask"/>
          </flowsInto>
        </inputCondition>
        <task id="manualTask">
          <name>Manual Task</name>
          <documentation>Task requiring human interaction</documentation>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="end"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="and"/>
          <decomposesTo id="manualTaskGateway"/>
          <resourcing>
            <offer initiator="system"/>
            <distributionSet>
              <initialSet>
                <participant>manager</participant>
                <participant>supervisor</participant>
              </initialSet>
              <filters>
                <filter name="roleFilter">
                  <param>
                    <name>department</name>
                    <refers>role</refers>
                  </param>
                </filter>
              </filters>
            </distributionSet>
            <allocate initiator="user"/>
            <start initiator="system"/>
            <privileges>
              <privilege name="canSuspend">
                <allowall>true</allowall>
              </privilege>
              <privilege name="canDelegate">
                <set>
                  <participant>delegateUser</participant>
                </set>
              </privilege>
            </privileges>
          </resourcing>
        </task>
        <outputCondition id="end">
          <name>End</name>
        </outputCondition>
      </processControlElements>
    </decomposition>
    <decomposition id="manualTaskGateway" xsi:type="WebServiceGatewayFactsType">
      <name>Manual Task Gateway</name>
      <documentation>Human task gateway</documentation>
      <externalInteraction>manual</externalInteraction>
    </decomposition>
  </specification>
</specificationSet>

complex_nested.name: Complex Nested Workflow
complex_nested.description: Creates a workflow with nested decompositions and complex patterns
complex_nested.prompt:
Generate a YAWL XML specification for a complex nested workflow:

{{requirements}}

Sub-workflows:
{{sub_workflows}}

The workflow should:
1. Use YAWL Schema 4.0
2. Include nested decompositions with sub-workflows
3. Implement multiple pattern combinations
4. Include proper data flow between levels
5. Use control types appropriately (AND, OR, XOR)
6. Validate against YAWL Schema 4.0

Generate the complete specification XML with nested structure.
complex_nested.example_output:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<specificationSet version="4.0" xmlns="http://www.yawlfoundation.org/yawlschema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.yawlfoundation.org/yawlschema http://www.yawlfoundation.org/yawlschema/YAWL_Schema4.0.xsd">
  <specification uri="complexNestedWorkflow">
    <metaData>
      <title>Complex Nested Workflow</title>
      <creator>YAWL Z.ai Generator</creator>
      <description>Complex workflow with nested decompositions</description>
      <version>1.0</version>
    </metaData>
    <decomposition id="mainWorkflow" xsi:type="NetFactsType" isRootNet="true">
      <name>Main Workflow</name>
      <inputParam name="mainInput">
        <type>xs:string</type>
      </inputParam>
      <processControlElements>
        <inputCondition id="start">
          <name>Start</name>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="parallelBranch"/>
          </flowsInto>
        </inputCondition>
        <task id="parallelBranch">
          <name>Parallel Branch Start</name>
          <documentation>Begins parallel processing</documentation>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="taskA"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="taskB"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="and"/>
        </task>
        <task id="taskA">
          <name>Process Data A</name>
          <documentation>First parallel processing task</documentation>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="subWorkflowA"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="and"/>
          <decomposesTo id="subA"/>
        </task>
        <task id="taskB">
          <name>Process Data B</name>
          <documentation>Second parallel processing task</documentation>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="subWorkflowB"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="and"/>
          <decomposesTo id="subB"/>
        </task>
        <task id="mergeResults">
          <name>Merge Results</name>
          <documentation>Merges results from sub-workflows</documentation>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="end"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="and"/>
        </task>
        <outputCondition id="end">
          <name>End</name>
        </outputCondition>
      </processControlElements>
    </decomposition>
    <decomposition id="subA" xsi:type="NetFactsType">
      <name>Sub-workflow A</name>
      <inputParam name="subInputA">
        <type>xs:string</type>
      </inputParam>
      <processControlElements>
        <inputCondition id="subStartA">
          <name>Start A</name>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="taskSubA1"/>
          </flowsInto>
        </inputCondition>
        <task id="taskSubA1">
          <name>Sub-task A1</name>
          <documentation>First sub-task in A</documentation>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="taskSubA2"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="and"/>
        </task>
        <task id="taskSubA2">
          <name>Sub-task A2</name>
          <documentation>Second sub-task in A</documentation>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="subEndA"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="and"/>
        </task>
        <outputCondition id="subEndA">
          <name>End A</name>
        </outputCondition>
      </processControlElements>
    </decomposition>
    <decomposition id="subB" xsi:type="NetFactsType">
      <name>Sub-workflow B</name>
      <inputParam name="subInputB">
        <type>xs:string</type>
      </inputParam>
      <processControlElements>
        <inputCondition id="subStartB">
          <name>Start B</name>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="choiceTaskB"/>
          </flowsInto>
        </inputCondition>
        <task id="choiceTaskB">
          <name>Choice Task B</name>
          <documentation>Choice point in sub-workflow B</documentation>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="taskB1"/>
            <predicate>priority == 'high'</predicate>
            <isDefaultFlow/>
          </flowsInto>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="taskB2"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="xor"/>
        </task>
        <task id="taskB1">
          <name>High Priority Task</name>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="subEndB"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="and"/>
        </task>
        <task id="taskB2">
          <name>Standard Task</name>
          <flowsInto>
            <nextElementRef id="subEndB"/>
          </flowsInto>
          <join code="xor"/>
          <split code="and"/>
        </task>
        <outputCondition id="subEndB">
          <name>End B</name>
        </outputCondition>
      </processControlElements>
    </decomposition>
  </specification>
</specificationSet>

generation_rules.schema_validation: All generated XML must validate against YAWL Schema 4.0
generation_rules.required_attributes: Check that all required attributes are present (uri, version, etc.)
generation_rules.element_consistency: Ensure all element references exist in the specification
generation_rules.control_type_validation: Use only valid control types: and, or, xor
generation_rules.unique_ids: Ensure all element IDs are unique within the specification
generation_rules.variable_scoping: Maintain proper variable scoping in nested decompositions

usage_examples.basic_usage: Replace variables like {{requirements}} with specific workflow requirements
usage_examples.complex_patterns: Combine multiple patterns by nesting decompositions
usage_examples.data_handling: Use inputParam, outputParam, and localVariable for data flow
usage_examples.resourcing: Configure resourcing for human tasks and external services
usage_examples.validation: Always validate generated XML against YAWL Schema 4.0
